com.ibm.opencard.isofs
Class MFCFileSysParameter

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.ibm.opencard.service.MFCCardServiceParameter
        |
        +--com.ibm.opencard.isofs.MFCFileParameter
              |
              +--com.ibm.opencard.isofs.MFCFileSysParameter
public class MFCFileSysParameter
extends MFCFileParameter

Encapsulation of the constructor arguments of MFCFileSystem. The number of arguments to a card service is rather high. To simplify the construction, this object encapsulates all parameters required for the File System service, except an optional pre-allocated channel. Every parameter can be set explicitly by a method invocation. Access to the parameters stored is provided only within this package.
The file system card service MFCFileSystem is derived from the file access card service MFCFileAccess. Consequently, the parameters are derived from the respective parameters, which are still required to invoke the base class constructor.

See Also:
MFCFileSystem, MFCFileParameter

Constructor Detail

MFCFileSysParameter

public MFCFileSysParameter()
Creates new parameters, initialized with null. All parameters required for instantiating a MFCFileSystem, including those for the base class, must be set explicitly afterwards.
See Also:
MFCFileSystem

MFCFileSysParameter

public MFCFileSysParameter(opencard.core.service.CardServiceScheduler scheduler,
                           opencard.core.service.SmartCard smartcard,
                           boolean blocking)
Creates new parameters, the standard ones already set. In the first version of OCF, all card services had the same constructor arguments. This constructor expects exactly those arguments, and stores them. The remaining arguments required for instantiating a MFCFileSystem, including those for the base class, have to be set explicitly afterwards.
Parameters:
scheduler - where to allocate channels
smartcard - the smartcard to contact
blocking - whether channel allocation can block
See Also:
MFCFileSystem, MFCFileParameter, MFCCardServiceParameter
Method Detail

setFileSystemImpl

public final void setFileSystemImpl(MFCFileSystemImpl fsimpl)
Sets the file system implementation to use. All file system services for a specific card OS version share a single file system service implementation, which is responsible for creating commands and interpreting the smartcard's response.
Parameters:
fsimpl - the file system implementation to use
